channel.title: Css on Massimiliano Canzi
channel.description: Recent content in Css on Massimiliano Canzi

item.title: Project 2
item.description: Presentations 2018 Stefano Coretta, Massimiliano Canzi The effect of lexical frequency on vowel phonation as a correlate of /t/- glottaling. Talk presented at the Linguistic Association of Great Britain (LAGB) conference in Sheffield, UK. 11-14th September, 2018. Abstract Introduction. Lexical frequency is known to modulate the effects of a phonetic bias on speech production, such that high-frequency words show a stronger effect for a particular bias since they are exposed more often to that bias (Bybee 2004).
